section.title: Technology Requirements
section.p: This is an online class, so it is essential that you have access to a computer, laptop, tablet, or at the very least a smart phone. And you need internet access. You should use Firefox, Chrome, or Safari as your web browser.

Ideally, your device and internet connection will work with Zoom in case we try to have a meeting. And you absolutely need a strong internet connection with Zoom for the proctored exams. If that is an obstacle, see for alternatives.

Also for the proctored exams, you must either use a computer with a detachable webcam, or be able to connect to the exam Zoom session twice, once with your computer and once with a device that has a camera (typically a phone or tablet).
We will use free graphing calculator apps called GeoGebra and Desmos. (You may choose which one you prefer).
You should have access to a printer to print the video lecture notes and worksheets. Or you should be comfortable with digitally annotating a PDF using a tablet or something similar.

You should have access to a scanner or scanning app to upload completed worksheets. Adobe Scan (with accessibility resources) is a free smartphone app for scanning documents that you could use. There are many other similar apps you could explore. With a scanning app, you take multiple photos with your phone, then click something when you are done. And the app produces a single PDF file with each picture on its own page.
